===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|ごがつびょう|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Literally “May disease” – the Japanese school year and financial year (including new hires) starts in April, thus by May, after the initial period, new students or new hires may be feeling a let-down or depression.

This is also associated with the change of seasons (spring to summer) – compare {{m|en|spring fever}} – and with the main public holiday season at the end of April and the start of May of each year ([[w:Golden_Week_(Japan)|Golden Week]]), specifically returning from holiday and re-adapting to work.
